ul.li1: 111 Balances of deceit are an abomination of Yahweh,
ul.li2: but an accurate weightLiterally “a full stone” or “a pure stone” delights him.
ul.li1: 2Pride comes, then disgrace comes,
ul.li2: but wisdom is with the humble.
ul.li1: 3The integrity of the upright guides them,
ul.li2: but the crookedness of the treacherous destroys them.
ul.li1: 4Wealth does not profit on the day of wrath,
ul.li2: but righteousness will deliver from death.
ul.li1: 5The righteousness of the blameless will keep his ways straight,
ul.li2: but the wicked will fall by his wickedness.
ul.li1: 6The righteousness of the upright will save them,
ul.li2: but by a scheme the treacherous will be taken captive.
ul.li1: 7With the death of a wicked person, hope will die,
ul.li2: and the expectation of the godless perishes.
ul.li1: 8The righteous is delivered from trouble,
ul.li2: but the wicked enters into it.
ul.li1: 9With a mouth, the godless shall destroy his neighbor,
ul.li2: but by knowledge the righteous are delivered.
ul.li1: 10When good is with the righteous, the city rejoices,
ul.li2: and with the perishing of the wicked, jubilation.
ul.li1: 11By the blessing of the upright, a city will be exalted,
ul.li2: but by the mouth of the wicked, it will be overthrown.
ul.li1: 12He who lacks senseLiterally “heart” belittles his neighbor,
ul.li2: but a person of intelligence will remain silent.
ul.li1: 13A gossip walks about telling a secret,
ul.li2: but the trustworthy in spirit keeps the matter.
ul.li1: 14Where there is no guidance, a nationOr “people” shall fall,
ul.li2: but there is safety in an abundance of counsel.
ul.li1: 15He will suffer trouble when he loans to a stranger,
ul.li2: but he who refuses a pledge is safe.
ul.li1: 16A woman of grace receives honor,
ul.li2: but the ruthless gets wealth.
ul.li1: 17A person of kindness rewards himself,Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: but a cruel person harms his own flesh.
ul.li1: 18The wicked earnsOr “does, makes” deceptive gain,Literally “gain of deception”
ul.li2: but he who sows righteousness, a true reward.Literally “a reward of truth”
ul.li1: 19He who is steadfast in righteousness is to life
ul.li2: asHebrew “and” he who pursues evil is to death.
ul.li1: 20An abomination of Yahweh are the crooked of heart,Literally “crooked ones of heart”; “heart” may also be translated “mind”
ul.li2: but his delight are those with blameless ways.Literally “blameless ones of ways”
ul.li1: 21Rest assured,Literally “Hand to hand” the wicked will not go unpunished,
ul.li2: but the offspringOr “seed” of the righteous will escape.
ul.li1: 22A ring of gold in the snout of a pig
ul.li2: is a woman who is beautiful but without discretion.
ul.li1: 23The desire of the righteous is only good,
ul.li2: but the expectation of the wicked, wrath.
ul.li1: 24There is one who gives yet grows richer,Literally “adding more”
ul.li2: but he who withholds what is rightLiterally “from what is right” only finds need.
ul.li1: 25A person of blessing will be enriched,
ul.li2: and he who gives water also will be refreshed.
ul.li1: 26He who withholds grain, the people curse him,
ul.li2: but a blessing is for the head of him who sells.
ul.li1: 27He who diligently seeks good seeks favor,
ul.li2: but he who inquires of evil, it will come to him.
ul.li1: 28He who trusts in his wealth is he who will fall,
ul.li2: but like a green leaf the righteous will flourish.
ul.li1: 29He who brings trouble to his household, he will inherit wind,Or “breath, spirit”
ul.li2: and a fool will serve the wise of heart.
ul.li1: 30The fruit of righteousness is a tree of life,
ul.li2: and he who captures soulsOr “persons,” or “inner selves” is wise.
ul.li1: 31If the righteous on earth will be repaid,
ul.li2: how much moreLiterally “more for” the wicked and sinner.
